failure_modes.description: Human brains think linearly, miss exponential effects
failure_modes.real_world_case: COVID-19 early spread - people couldn't grasp exponential growth.
failure_modes.quantitative_threshold: 7% growth doubles in 10 years, 10% in 7 years

failure_modes.real_world_case: 2% annual fees reducing retirement wealth by 40% over 30 years.
failure_modes.quantitative_threshold: 1% annual fee = 26% less wealth over 30 years

failure_modes.real_world_case: Selling investments during downturns, missing recovery.
failure_modes.quantitative_threshold: Missing best 10 days in 20 years cuts returns by 50%

failure_modes.real_world_case: Starting retirement savings at 40 vs 25 requires 3x contributions.
failure_modes.quantitative_threshold: 10 years earlier start = 2x final wealth
Volatility drag = (standard deviation)² / 2

failure_modes.real_world_case: Software testing - can't test all input combinations.
failure_modes.quantitative_threshold: 10 binary choices = 1,024 combinations

failure_modes.real_world_case: Security systems with insufficient key space.
failure_modes.quantitative_threshold: 23 people = 50% chance of shared birthday

failure_modes.real_world_case: Misunderstanding probability in sequential events.
failure_modes.quantitative_threshold: Permutations can be n! times larger than combinations

failure_modes.real_world_case: Survivorship bias - only seeing successful combinations.
failure_modes.quantitative_threshold: Visible successes may be < 1% of attempts

failure_modes.description: Trying to optimize over too many combinations
failure_modes.real_world_case: Overfitting in machine learning - optimizing noise.
failure_modes.quantitative_threshold: Parameters should be < 10% of data points

failure_modes.description: Not thinking about what to avoid
failure_modes.real_world_case: Planning for success without planning to avoid failure.
failure_modes.quantitative_threshold: Avoiding mistakes often more valuable than seeking wins

failure_modes.real_world_case: Asking 'how to succeed' but not 'how would I fail'.
failure_modes.quantitative_threshold: Invert every major goal and decision

failure_modes.real_world_case: Knowing what could go wrong but not preventing it.
failure_modes.quantitative_threshold: Each identified risk needs a mitigation action

failure_modes.description: Focusing so much on failure that you don't act
failure_modes.real_world_case: Paralysis from seeing too many ways to fail.
failure_modes.quantitative_threshold: Mitigate top 5 risks, accept the rest

failure_modes.description: Not updating inversion as situation changes
failure_modes.real_world_case: Old risk analysis no longer relevant.
failure_modes.quantitative_threshold: Update inversion analysis quarterly

failure_modes.description: Giving up just before tipping point
failure_modes.real_world_case: Startups failing at 80% of needed traction.
failure_modes.quantitative_threshold: Many successes happen just after most give up

failure_modes.real_world_case: Underestimating users needed for network effects.
failure_modes.quantitative_threshold: Critical mass often 2-3x initial estimates

failure_modes.real_world_case: Social networks losing critical mass (MySpace).
failure_modes.quantitative_threshold: Critical mass requires ongoing maintenance

failure_modes.real_world_case: Fake users not creating real network effects.
failure_modes.quantitative_threshold: 1,000 engaged users > 100,000 inactive users

failure_modes.real_world_case: Dominant in dying market.
failure_modes.quantitative_threshold: Critical mass in growing market > dominance in shrinking

failure_modes.real_world_case: Assuming market share will remain stable.
failure_modes.quantitative_threshold: Average S&P 500 company lifespan: 20 years and declining

failure_modes.real_world_case: Financial systems that look stable until they collapse.
failure_modes.quantitative_threshold: Stable-looking systems can collapse in days

failure_modes.real_world_case: Currency pegs that eventually break.
failure_modes.quantitative_threshold: Fighting equilibrium eventually fails

failure_modes.real_world_case: Assuming only one market outcome possible.
failure_modes.quantitative_threshold: Most systems have multiple possible equilibria

failure_modes.description: Right about equilibrium, wrong about timing
failure_modes.real_world_case: Shorting bubbles too early.
failure_modes.quantitative_threshold: Markets can stay irrational longer than you can stay solvent

failure_modes.real_world_case: Large companies failing to adapt while nimble ones survive.
failure_modes.quantitative_threshold: Adaptability > strength for long-term survival

failure_modes.description: Optimizing for current environment, missing global maximum
failure_modes.real_world_case: Kodak optimized for film, missed digital.
failure_modes.quantitative_threshold: Allocate 10-20% to exploration beyond current optimum

failure_modes.description: Running fast just to stay in place
failure_modes.real_world_case: Competitive industries where everyone improves but no one gains.
failure_modes.quantitative_threshold: If everyone's improving equally, no one gains advantage

failure_modes.description: Not preparing for rare catastrophic events
failure_modes.real_world_case: Businesses unprepared for pandemic.
failure_modes.quantitative_threshold: Extinction events happen every 50-100 years in business

failure_modes.description: Keeping outdated structures that no longer serve purpose
failure_modes.real_world_case: Legacy systems and processes that waste resources.
warning_signs: We've always done it this way
failure_modes.quantitative_threshold: 10-20% of activities typically vestigial

failure_modes.description: Not seeing how parts depend on each other
failure_modes.real_world_case: Killing predators causing prey overpopulation and ecosystem collapse.
failure_modes.quantitative_threshold: Every action has 5-10 second-order effects

failure_modes.real_world_case: Losing key supplier that entire industry depends on.
failure_modes.quantitative_threshold: Keystone failure can collapse entire ecosystem

failure_modes.description: Lack of diversity creating systemic risk
failure_modes.real_world_case: Irish potato famine - single crop variety.
failure_modes.quantitative_threshold: Monocultures are 10x more vulnerable to shocks

failure_modes.real_world_case: Incumbents ignoring disruptive startups.
failure_modes.quantitative_threshold: Disruptors often start in ignored niches

failure_modes.real_world_case: Overfishing depleting fish stocks.
failure_modes.quantitative_threshold: Exceeding carrying capacity leads to collapse
